document.masterDocTitle: Mangelia (Gastropoda, Conoidea) species of the Turkish coasts with description of Mangelia vanaartseni sp. nov.

Remarks : Among the
Mangelia
species distributed in the Mediterranean Sea,
M. costulata
is the easiest to identify due to its equal, thin and numerous spiral cords. The shell has a multispiral protoconch and orthocline axial ribs on teleoconch whorls (on the body whorl 9–10 ribs).
